materials: RED HEART® With Love: 1 Skein each 1530 Violet A and 1909 Holly Berry B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Yarn needle, two 1” buttons, matching thread and sewing needle.
abbreviations: Rsc = Working from left to right, insert hook into next st, yo, pull up loop, yo, pull through both loops on hook.
A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CASE
Back Panel
With A, ch 26.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 2nd ch from hook, * sc in next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn – 25 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip 1st st, * dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across; dc in turning ch; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Panel is 10” from beginning, ending with a Wrong Side row.
Next Round: Ch 1, work sc evenly around Panel, working 2 sc in each corner. Fasten off.
Front Panel
Work same as for Back Panel until Front Panel is 9.5” from beginning.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Next Row: Repeat last row.
Next Row-Buttonholes: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts, sc in next 6 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts, sc in last 7 sts; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Next Round: Ch 1, work sc evenly around Panel, working 2 sc in each corner. Fasten off.
HEART
With B, ch 17.
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in next ch; turn to work in unused loops of beginning ch, sc in next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in next 6 ch – 32 sts.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 5 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in next 7 sc – 38 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 4 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in next 8 sts – 44 sts.
Round 4: Sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 8 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 9 sts – 50 sts.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; skip next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; sc in next 9 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 10 sts – 56 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Heart to Front Panel. Place Panels with wrong sides together and Front Panel on top. 
Row 1: Join A in top left corner, ch 1, sc in same st; matching sts and working in back loops only, sc around 3 sides, leaving top open. DO NOT TURN.
Row 2: Ch 1, working left to right, rsc in each st around. Fasten off.
Weave in all ends. Sew buttons on wrong side of Back Panel, matching to buttonholes on Front Panel.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 3945 Blue Suede
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
Scissors
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10cm); 14 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Protect your iPad® from dings and scratches by crocheting this quick and easy cover. With over a hundred colors in RED HEART® Super Saver®, you can choose your favorite to personalize it further!

Notes
1. Cozy is worked in a continuous spiral with Right Side always facing. Do not turn unless otherwise indicated. Use stitch marker to keep track of beginning of rounds. Weave in ends as you go.
2. Ribbing is worked in rows and joined to top of Cozy as work progresses.

COZY
Ch 26.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 23 chs, 3 sc in last ch, turn; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 23 chs, 2 sc in last ch – 52 sc.
Rounds 2-33: Sc in each sc around.
Round 34: Sc in each sc around, slip st in next sc.
Do not fasten off.

Ribbing
Ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 7 sc, slip st in next 2 sc of Round 34, turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Sc in back loop of next 8 sc, ch 1, turn.
Row 3: Sc in back loop of next 8 sc, slip st in next 2 sc of Round 34, turn.
Rows 4-51: Repeat Rows 2-3, 24 times.
Row 52: Working in both back loops of Row 51 and free loops of Row 1, sc in each st across, slip st in top of Row 1.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® "Soft Yarn": 2 Balls No. 9523 Dark Leaf CA; small amounts No. 6768 Pink CB, No. 4600 White CC, and No. 9537 Fuchsia CD.
Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: CA, CB, etc = Colors A, B, etc
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cover designed to fit a 12 1/4" x 10" x 1 1/2" laptop.
gauge: 18 sts = 4"; 11 rnds = 4" in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
To Change Color in Rounds: Work the last stitch of the round; drop the color in use; work the slip stitch of the joining with the color needed for the next round and continue with that color. 

Note: Work only the beginning chain through Rnd 4 with two strands of yarn held together as one to make a tight fabric that will add padding to the base of the case. 

With two strands of CA held together, ch 28. 
Rnd 1: 5 Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 25 ch, 5 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of beg ch, sc in next 25 ch; join with a sl st in first sc – 60 sc. 

Rnd 2: Ch 1, * [2 sc in next sc] 5 times, sc in next 25 sc; rep from * once more; join – 70 sc. 

Rnd 3: Ch 1, * [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 5 times, sc in next 25 sc; rep from * once more; join – 80 sc. 

Rnd 4: Ch 1, * [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times, sc in next 25 sc; rep from * once more; join – 90 sc. Cut one strand of CA and fasten it off; remainder of case will be worked with single strand. 

Rnds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. 

Rnd 8: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in next sc and in each sc around; join to top of ch-3. 

Rep Rnd 8 until case measures approximately 6" from bottom, or half of desired length, changing to CB when joining last rnd. 

Next Rnd: With CB, ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each dc around; join, changing to CC. 

Next Rnd: With CC, ch 3 (counts as first dc), * tr in next sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next sc, hdc in next sc **, dc in next sc; rep from * around, end at **; join, changing to CD. 

Next Rnd: With CD, ch 4 (counts as first tr), * 3 tr in next tr, tr in next dc; [holding back last lp on hook, tr in next st] 3 times, yo and draw through all 4 lps on hook – tr cluster made **; tr in next dc; rep from * around, end at **; join to top of ch-4, changing to CC. 

Next Rnd: With CC, ch 3 (counts as first dc), * hdc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, tr in next st **, dc in next st; rep from * around, end at **; join, changing to CB. 

Next Rnd: With CB, ch 1, sc in each st around; join, changing to CA. 

Next Rnd: With CA, ch 3, dc in next sc and in each sc around; join to top of ch-3. 

Rep last Rnd until case measures 12 3/4" from beg, or until 1/2" less than desired length. Change to CB when joining last rnd. 

Next Rnd: With CB, ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each dc around; join, changing to CC. 

Next Rnd: With CC, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join, changing to CD. 

Next Rnd: With CD, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends. 

(4 Medium) RED HEART® "Soft Yarn™", Art. E728 (5 ounce/256 yard solid; 4 ounce/204 yard multi color ball).

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 3955 Wildflower
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
Scissors
Stitch marker
gauge: 7 sts = 2” (5cm); 7 rows = 2” (5cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Cozy is worked in a continuous spiral with Right Side always facing. Do not turn unless otherwise indicated. Use stitch marker to keep track of beginning of rounds. Weave in ends as you go.
2. Ribbing is worked in rows and joined to top of Cozy as work progresses.

COZY
Ch 9.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 6 chs, 3 sc in last ch, turn; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 6 chs, 2 sc in last ch – 18 sc.
Rounds 2-12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: Sc in each sc around, slip st in next sc. Do not fasten off.

Ribbing
Ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 sc, slip st in next 2 sc of Round 13, turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Sc in back loop of next 4 sc, ch 1, turn.
Row 3: Sc in back loop of next 4 sc, slip st in next 2 sc of Round 13, turn.
Rows 4-17: Repeat Rows 2-3, 7 times.
Row 18: Working in both back loops of Row 17 and free loops of Row 1, sc in each st across, slip st in top of Row 1.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 47 m/50 yds
Contrast B Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball or 47 m/50 yds
Contrast C Sunshine (00073) 1 ball or 47 m/50 yds
Contrast D Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 47 m/50 yds
Contrast E Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 47 m/50 yds
Anchor® Embroidery Floss in Black (0403) 1 spool
Size U.S. D/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 button.
measurements: To fit device approx 7½" x 9½" [19 x 24 cm].
instructions:
This diagram shows where the horizontal bar is located (on WS of rnd).
Notes: 
• This pattern will naturally slant to the bias as you work. It will not affect finished item.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
• With A, ch 84. Join in ring with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.

1st rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in first ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. * Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 ch. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook – hdc3tog made. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. 3 hdc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to last 11 ch. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. 3 hdc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of last 2 ch. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

Note: Proceed as follows for rem rnds: Work hdc in horizontal bar created at back of work between stitches of previous rnd (bar is below loops normally worked- see diagram on page 1). This leaves a ‘ridge’ of top chains across each rnd.

2nd rnd:  Join B with sl st in horizontal bar at back of last hdc of previous rnd. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp. Working in horizontal bars created at back of work between stitches of previous rnd,  1 hdc in each of next 2 bars. *Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 bars. 3 hdc in next bar. 1 hdc in each of next 5 bars. Rep from * to last 10 sts. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 bars. 3 hdc in next bar. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

3rd rnd: With C, as 2nd rnd.
4th rnd: With D, as 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: With E, as 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: With A, as 2nd rnd.

Rep 2nd to 6th rnds for Stripe Pat until work from beg (measured point to point) measures approx 9" [23 cm] ending on a 3rd rnd of Stripe Pat.

Next rnd:  Join D with sl st in horizontal bar at back of center hdc of last 3 hdc group of previous rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. Working in horizontal bars created at back of work between sts of previous rnd, 1 sc in next bar. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. *[(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next bar. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – tr3tog made. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. 1 hdc in next bar. 1 sc in each of next 3 bars. 1 hdc in next bar. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. Rep from * to last 8 sts. Tr3tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. 1 hdc in next bar. 1 sc in last bar. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off.

Button loop:  With C, sl st across to center back of last rnd. Ch 36 (button loop). Join with sl st in center back. Fasten off.

Sew button to front to correspond to button loop.

Bottom edging: Working into rem loops of foundation ch, join E with sl st in any rem loop of center ch of hdc3tog from 1st rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. *Tr3tog over next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last 8 ch. Tr3tog over next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Join bottom edging:  Turn work inside out and line up bottom edging. Working through both thicknesses,  join E with sl st in corner. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each st across to opposite corner. Fasten off.

Monogram: With embroidery floss and using back stitch, embroider monogram to front of case.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 17 yds/15.5 m
Anchor® Embroidery Floss in Black (0403)
Embroidery needle
2 black beads for eyes
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
measurements: To fit average earbud case - 2¼" x 2¾" [5.5 x 7 cm]
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Top
Ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join. 14 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Bottom
Ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join. 14 sc.
3rd to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
With edges of Top and Bottom held tog, sew tog, leaving most of edges unworked for opening.
Ears (make 2)
Ch 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off.
Sew Ears to Top as shown in photo.
Sew beads for Eyes to Top as shown in photo.
Using length of Black embroidery floss and straight stitch, embroider whiskers and nose.

pattern_name: CROCHET RAINBOW STRIPES TABLET OR MOBILE PHONE COVER
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Contrast A 01740 (Hot Pink) 1 ball
Contrast B 00095 (Red) 1 ball
Contrast C 01699 (Tangerine) 1 ball
Contrast D 01712 (Hot Green) 1 ball
Contrast E 01742 (Hot Blue) 1 ball
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. D or 4) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 button.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Small: To fit device approx 2½" x 4½" [6 x 11.5 cm]. Large: To fit device approx 7½" x 9½" [19 x 24 cm].
instructions:
See Diagram on page 3.
Small Version
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st. With A, ch 15.
1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 11 ch. 3 hdc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of next 11 ch. 1 hdc in last ch. Join with sl st to first hdc. 27 sts. Fasten off.
Note: Proceed as follows for rem rnds: Work hdc in horizontal bar created at back of work between stitches of previous rnd (bar is below loops normally worked- see diagram above). This leaves ‘ridge’ of top chain across each rnd.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in horizontal bar at back of last hdc of previous rnd. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp. *1 hdc in horizontal bar at back of next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: With C, as 2nd rnd.
4th rnd: With D, as 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: With E, as 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: With A, as 2nd rnd.
Rep 2nd to 6th rnds twice more. Do not fasten off.
Cont as follows for button loop: With A, sl st across each st to center back of last rnd. Ch 24 (button loop). Join with sl st in center back. Fasten off.
Sew button to front to correspond to button loop.
Large Version
Note: This pattern will naturally slant to the bias as you work. It will not affect finished item.
Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
With A, ch 84. Join in ring with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. *Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 ch. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook – hdc3tog made. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. 3 hdc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to last 11 ch. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. 3 hdc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of last 2 ch. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
Note: Proceed as follows for rem rnds: Work hdc in horizontal bar created at back of work between stitches of previous rnd (bar is below loops normally worked- see diagram on page 1). This leaves a ‘ridge’ of top chains across each rnd.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in horizontal bar at back of last hdc of previous rnd. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp. Working in horizontal bars created at back of work between stitches of previous rnd, 1 hdc in each of next 2 bars. *Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 bars. 3 hdc in next bar. 1 hdc in each of next 5 bars. Rep from * to last 11 sts. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 bars. 3 hdc in next bar. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: With C, as 2nd rnd.
4th rnd: With D, as 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: With E, as 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: With A, as 2nd rnd.
Rep 2nd to 6th rnds for Stripe Pat until work from beg (measured point to point) measures approx 9" [23 cm] ending on a 3rd rnd of Stripe Pat.
Next rnd: Join D with sl st in horizontal bar at back of center hdc of last 3 hdc group of previous rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. Working in horizontal bars created at back of work between sts of previous rnd, 1 sc in next bar. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. *[(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next bar. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – tr3tog made. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. 1 hdc in next bar. 1 sc in each of next 3 bars. 1 hdc in next bar. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. Rep from * to last 8 sts. Tr3tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 bars. 1 hdc in next bar. 1 sc in last bar. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off.
Button loop: With C, sl st across to center back of last rnd. Ch 36 (button loop). Join with sl st in center back. Fasten off.
Sew button to front to correspond to button loop.
Bottom edging: Working into rem loops of foundation ch, join E with sl st in any rem loop of center ch of hdc3tog from 1st rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. *Tr3tog over next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last 8 ch. Tr3tog over next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join bottom edging: Turn work inside out and line up bottom edging. Working through both thicknesses, join E with sl st in corner. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each st across to opposite corner. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “SuperSaver®”: 2 balls 985 Urban Camo A; 1 ball 312 Black B.
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
four buttons - 1” diameter
matching thread and needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 13 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CASE
Back Panel
With A, ch 46. 
Row 1 (wrong side): Dc in 2nd ch from hook, *sc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * across. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, *dc in next sc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across, dc in beginning ch. 
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 11” from beginning, ending with wrong side row. 
Last Round: Ch 1, work sc evenly around piece, working sc in each st and each edge of row and working 2 sc in each corner, slip st in first ch to join.
Fasten off.
Front Panel
With A, ch 46. 
Work as for Back Panel until piece measures 10½” from beginning. 
Row 1-2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Buttonhole Row: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 3 sts, ch 3, skip 3 sts, *sc in next 9 sts, ch 3, skip 3 sts; repeat from * to last 3 sts, sc in last 3 sts. 
Next Row: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across, working 3 sc in ch-3 spaces. 
Repeat Row 1. 
Last Round: Ch 1, work sc evenly around piece, working sc in each st and each edge of row and working 2 sc in each corner, slip st in first ch to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With wrong sides together and Front Panel on top, Join B with a sc in top left corner. Matching stitches and working in back loops only of both layers, sc around 3 sides to join layers. Leave top edge open. Do not turn. Working from left to right, ch 1, work in reverse single crochet in each st around, slip st in first st to join. 
Fasten off.
Edging
Join B in corner of opening, sc evenly around opening, slip st in first st to join. Do not turn. Working from left to right, ch 1, work in reverse single crochet in each st around, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends. Sew buttons on wrong side of Back Panel opposite buttonholes.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer®: 1 ball of 1635 Lipstick
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5 mm [US H-8] and 4.5 mm [US 7]
Yarn Needle
10” (25.5 cm) length of open link metal chain
One 9/16” (14 mm) button
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: Interior pocket measures: 4¾” (12 cm) wide x 3¼” (8.5 cm) deep. Exterior measure: 5½” (14 cm) wide x 3½” (9 cm) tall.
gauge: With larger hook, 12 sts and 13 rows in pattern = 3” (7.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
BAG
Front 
With larger hook, ch 22.
Set-up Row (WS): Change to smaller hook, working in back bumps of ch sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 21 sc.
Row 1 (RS): Ch 1, sc in first st, *Cl in next st, sc in next st; repeat from *across; turn – 11 sc, 10 Cl.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st to end of the row. [21 sc]
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sts, *Cl in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * until 1 st remains un-worked, sc in last st. [12 sc, 9 Cl]
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn – 21 sc.
Rows 5-12: Repeat Rows 1-4 twice.
Rows 13-14: Repeat Rows 1-2. Cut yarn, leaving a 50” (127 cm) long tail. Drop loop and secure to be picked up later.
Back
Row 1: With RS facing and smaller hook, working across opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with a slip st in first ch, ch 1, sc in each ch across; turn – 21 sc.
Rows 2-13: Repeat rows 2-13 of Front.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each of first 10 sts, (slip st, ch 9, slip st) in next st for button loop, sc in each of next 10 sts; turn. Do not cut yarn.
FINISHING
First Edging
With WS together, fold purse in half along Set-up Row, ch 1, turn work 90 degrees to work along side edge, working though double thickness of Front and Back, sc in each row-end st across to fold, slip st in Set-up Row. Fasten off.
Second Edging
Pick up dropped loop at end last row of Front, work same as First Edging.
Handle
With smaller hook and leaving a 10” (25.5 cm) tail, ch 45. Fasten off with 10” (25.5 cm) tail. Weave crocheted chain thru links of metal chain. Use long tails to sew each end of metal chain to top corners of Purse.
Button
Sew button between 5th and 6th Cl on Front.
Weave in ends
Special Stitches Used
2-dc cluster (Cl): [Yarn over, insert in indicated st, yarn over, draw yarn though, yarn over, draw yarn through 2 loops on hook] twice in same st, yarn over, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.
Pattern Notes
Front and Back of purse are worked off of a central foundation ch. Then edges of purse are single crocheted together. Chain handle has a length of crocheted yarn woven thru the links, which is then sewn in place.

pattern_name: Lily® sugar’n cream® mobile phone covers
materials: Lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Version 1 contrast a Warm Brown (01130) 15 m/16.5 yds or 1 ball
Version 1 contrast b Hot Blue (01742) 5.5 m/6 yds or 1 ball
Version 1 contrast c Tangerine (01699)  5.5 m/6 yds or 1 ball
Version 1 contrast D Hot Green (01712)  5.5 m/6 yds or 1 ball
Version 2 contrast a Sage Green (00084) 5.5 m/6 yds or 1 ball
Version 2 contrast b Warm Brown (01130) 5.5 m/6 yds or 1 ball
Version 2 contrast c Hot Green (01712)  5.5 m/6 yds or 1 ball
Version 2 contrast D Hot Blue (01742) 18.5 m/20 yds or 1 ball
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 button
measurements: To fit device approx 2½” x 4½” [6 x 11.5 cm].
instructions:
InstructIons
VersIon 1
**With A, ch 14.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. Miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch) 
5 times. Ch 1. Miss next ch. (1 sc. Ch 1) twice in last ch. Working across 
opposite side of foundation ch, (miss next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 1) 5 
times. 1 sc in last ch. Ch 1. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next 
sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. Miss last 
sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.**
3rd rnd: Join B with sl st in last ch-1 sp of previous rnd. Ch 1.  
1 sc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 
around, ending with ch 1. Miss last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off.
5th and 6th rnds: With C, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
7th and 8th rnds: With A, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
9th and 10th rnds: With D, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
11th and 12th rnds: With A, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
13th and 14th rnds: With C, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
15th and 16th rnds: With B, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
17th and 18th rnds: With A, as 3rd and 4th rnds. Do not fasten off A.
19th rnd: With A, as 2nd rnd.
20th rnd: With D, as 3rd rnd. Do not fasten off.
Cont as follows for button loop: With D, sl st across each st and 
ch-1 sp to center back of last rnd. Ch 24 (button loop). Join with  
sl st in center back. Fasten off.
Sew button to front to correspond to button loop.
VersIon 2
Work from ** to ** as given for Version 1.
3rd rnd: Join B with sl st in last ch-1 sp of previous rnd. Ch 1.  
1 sc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 
around, ending with ch 1. Miss last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th and 6th rnds: With C, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
7th and 8th rnds: With A, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
9th and 10th rnds: With B, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
11th to 14th rnds: With D, as 3rd and 4th rnds twice.
15th and 16th rnds: With C, as 3rd and 4th rnds.
17th to 20th rnds: With D, as 3rd and 4th rnds twice. Do not fasten 
off.
Cont as follows for button loop: With D, sl st across each st and 
ch-1 sp to center back of last rnd. Ch 24 (button loop). Join with 
 sl st in center back. Fasten off.
Sew button to front to correspond to button loop.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Grass (28223) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 button
Tapestry needle
measurements: Approx 7½" [19 cm] wide x 9½" [24 cm] high.
instructions:
Chain (ch) 15.
1st row: (RS). 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd chain (ch) from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (rep) last row until work from beg measures 19" [48.5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row (button loop): Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Ch 8. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Fasten off.
FINIShINg
Fold piece in half. Using tapestry needle, sew side seams. Sew button to front to correspond to button loop.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds)
Main Color (MC) Iris (9747) - 1 for Cell Phone, 1 for Tablet, 1 for iPad
measurements: Cell Phone: 2.5" X 5" (6.25 cm X 12.5 cm); Tablet: 6" X 9.5" (15 cm X 24 cm); iPad: 7.5" X 9.5" (19 cm X 24 cm)
gauge: In tilted stitch, 16 sts and 12 rows = 4"/10 cm. Remember to check gauge for best results!
instructions:
Tilted Stitch (multiple of 3 sts + 3)

DESCRIPTION SIZING

Chain multiple of 3 + 3.
Row 1: Work 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, *skip 2 ch, (1 sc, 2 dc) in next ch; repeat from * to last 3 ch, skip 2 ch, 1 sc in last ch, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in first sc, *skip 2 dc, (1 sc, 2 dc) in next sc; repeat from across, ending skip 2 dc, 1 sc in last ch, turn.
Repeat Row 2 for tilted st.

NOTE 
Cozy is crocheted back and forth, then sewn leaving a flap to close.

COZY
Ch 12 (27, 33). Work in tilted st until piece measures 12.5 (24, 24)"/31.5 (61, 61)cm. Fasten off.

FINISHING 
Fold beg edge up 5 (9.5, 9.5)"/12.5 (24, 24)cm. Sew side edges.

Closure
Insert electronic item in cozy to check for size. Fold flap over to enclose. Attach yarn to flap in center. Crochet chain long enough to go around button. Attach button loop to joining spot. Weave in ends. Sew button to front of pocket.

Strap (optional)
Join yarn to fold of cozy. Chain to desired length of strap, turn. Skip 4 ch (counts as dc and loop), dc in every ch across. Join to cozy at end of row. Sew button to opposite side of fold of cozy.

materials: RED HEART® With Love: 1 ball each 1530 Violet A and 1909 Holly Berry B
Susan Bate® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle, two 1” (2.5 cm) buttons, matching thread and sewing needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc;
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified;
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEART
With B, ch 17.
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in next ch; turn to work in unused loops of beginning ch, sc in next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in next 6 ch – 32 sts.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 5 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in next 7 sc – 38 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 4 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in next 8 sts – 44 sts.
Round 4: Sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 8 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 9 sts – 50 sts.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; skip next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; sc in next 9 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 10 sts – 56 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Heart to Front Panel. Place Panels with wrong sides together and Front Panel on top. Row 1: Join A in top left corner, ch 1, sc in same st; matching sts and working in back loops only, sc around 3 sides, leaving top open. DO NOT TURN.

BACK PANEL
With A, ch 26.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Dc in 2nd ch from hook, * sc in next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn – 25 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip 1st st, * dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across; dc in turning ch; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Panel is 10” (25.4 cm) from beginning, ending with a Wrong Side row.
Next Round: Ch 1, work sc evenly around Panel, working 2 sc in each corner. Fasten off.

FRONT PANEL
Work same as for Back Panel until Front Panel is 9.5” (24 cm) from beginning.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Next Row: Repeat last row.
Next Row-Buttonholes: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts, sc in next 6 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts, sc in last 7 sts; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Next Round: Ch 1, work sc evenly around Panel, working 2 sc in each corner. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Row 2: Ch 1, working left to right, rsc in each st around. Fasten off. Weave in all ends. Sew buttons on wrong side of Back Panel, matching to buttonholes on Front Panel.
